Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "It's a Wonderful Life" (1946) and "You" (2014) as potential recommendations.

"It's a Wonderful Life" is a classic American film that tells the story of George Bailey (played by Lionel Barrymore), a young man who dreams big and believes in himself. However, due to his poor financial situation, George seems like he will never be able to achieve his dreams. But then, one night, just before Christmas, George receives a visit from an angel named Clarence (played by Frank Faylen)). In the film, Clarence tells George that life is not fair and that everyone has to work for what they want in their life. Therefore, even though George seems like he will never be able to achieve his dreams, due to the fact that life is not fair and that everyone has to work for what they want in their life, it's possible that one day, George may actually end up achieving his dreams.

I would recommend "Bram Stoker's Dracula" as it is one of the most iconic and beloved horror movies ever made.
It follows the story of Count Dracula, a vampire from Transylvania who has come to England in search of a young woman named Mina Murray.
Dracula becomes infatuated with Mina, and he begins toying with her mind, leading her to believe things that are not actually true.
However, Mina's friend Harker, a barrister in London, is also infatuated with Mina.
Harker discovers Dracula's presence in England and becomes determined to uncover Dracula's secrets and save Mina from Dracula's clutches.
The movie "Bram Stoker' s Dracula" is filled with suspense, horror, and mystery. It is a classic example of a horror movie.
